predictions.text: U.S. DHS (ICE/HSI) will publicly announce a single-day worksite/logistics enforcement operation resulting in at least 250 arrests/detentions across one metro area, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Official DHS/ICE/HSI press release or official statement (or congressional testimony citing a specific operation) that reports >=250 arrests/detentions tied to a single-day operation targeting warehouses/import distribution/logistics facilities within one metro area.
evidence: Expansion of worksite/warehouse immigration raids into logistics nodes suggests rising likelihood of large-scale operations: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/27/nyregion/immigration-arrests-import-warehouses-new-jersey.html
Second-term agenda emphasizes tighter immigration enforcement, increasing operational tempo: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/27/us/politics/trump-second-term-promises-actions.html
monitoring_signals: ICE/HSI field office press releases referencing 'worksite enforcement' and 'logistics/warehouse' targets
State/local reports of multi-site raids near major ports (NY/NJ, LA/LB, Houston, Savannah)
DHS budget or staffing reallocations toward HSI worksite enforcement
predictions.rationale: Recent reporting indicates raids are moving into import-distribution nodes; scaling to a single-day, high-count operation is plausible but not assured.

predictions.text: The USTR will publish a Federal Register notice imposing an additional tariff rate of at least 10% on a defined list of imports with an estimated annual import value of at least $50 billion (as stated by USTR/ITC or reported by Reuters/Bloomberg), effective no later than 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Federal Register notice from USTR establishing new/additional duties with rate >=10% on an enumerated HTS list; USTR/ITC (or Reuters/Bloomberg citing USTR/ITC) must state or estimate affected annual import value >=$50B; effective date on/before 2026-09-30.
evidence: Historical evidence and renewed political emphasis suggest higher tariff risk: https://feeds.feedblitz.com/~/939366320/0/marginalrevolution~The-Macroeconomic-Effects-of-Tariffs-Evidence-From-US-Historical-Data.html
Administration agenda highlights tougher trade posture: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/27/us/politics/trump-second-term-promises-actions.html
monitoring_signals: USTR docket openings and Section 301/232 announcements
White House trade statements mentioning broad new tariff schedules
ITC briefing papers estimating affected import value
predictions.rationale: Trade posture is tightening; whether it reaches a $50B+ scope at >=10% by the deadline is uncertain.

predictions.text: At least one of Moody’s, S&P Global Ratings, or Fitch will downgrade (not just place on watch) a rated U.S. private student-loan ABS tranche, citing increased bankruptcy discharge risk and/or higher-than-expected losses, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A published rating action report from Moody’s/S&P/Fitch that (1) downgrades a U.S. private student-loan ABS tranche and (2) explicitly cites bankruptcy discharge trends/standards and/or related loss increases as a key driver.
evidence: Rising student-loan bankruptcy discharge activity could pressure credit performance over time: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/12/27/business/student-loans-bankruptcy.html
monitoring_signals: Rating-agency surveillance reports flagging bankruptcy-related loss severity changes
Higher delinquency/charge-off metrics in private student-loan trusts
Legal/regulatory updates lowering discharge barriers further
predictions.rationale: Bankruptcy discharge trends are shifting, but translating into ABS downgrades depends on portfolio seasoning, enhancement, and loss timing.

predictions.text: The European Commission will publish a formal legislative proposal (COM document) creating or scaling an EU-level funding program of at least €10 billion specifically for AI compute infrastructure (data centers, accelerators, or AI supercomputing) and/or associated grid/power enablement, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A European Commission COM document proposing a new or expanded program with total proposed budget >=€10B that is explicitly framed around AI compute capacity (and/or required power/grid buildout for AI compute).
evidence: Europe faces a capital-allocation push toward AI competitiveness and compute access: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/27/europe-at-fork-in-the-road-between-ai-competition-and-climate.html
AI strategies can be constrained by infrastructure buildout execution: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/27/has-the-uks-ai-infrastructure-buildout-been-a-success.html
monitoring_signals: EC speeches referencing 'AI compute' as a budget line item for the next MFF/industrial plan
Draft COM documents or leaks referencing EU AI compute facilities
Member-state coalition letters pushing EU-level compute funding
predictions.rationale: Compute scarcity is salient, but reaching a €10B+ EU-level COM proposal within one year is ambitious.

predictions.text: LME 3-month copper will settle at or above $10,500 per metric tonne at least once, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: London Metal Exchange official settlement price for Copper, 3-month contract, is >= $10,500/tonne on at least one trading day on/before 2026-06-30.
evidence: AI data-center scaling may be constrained by copper and interconnect limits, raising capex pressures: https://spectrum.ieee.org/rf-over-fiber
monitoring_signals: LME inventory trends and canceled warrants
Major mine disruption headlines (Chile/Peru) and TC/RC moves
Hyperscaler capex acceleration tied to power+network builds
predictions.rationale: AI/power buildouts support demand, but macro slowdown or supply response could cap prices.

predictions.text: Amazon (AWS) will announce a North America data-center power procurement deal totaling at least 1.0 GW of nameplate capacity (PPAs, generation acquisition, or dedicated build agreement), by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: AWS/Amazon press release, SEC filing, or reputable reporting (Reuters/Bloomberg/FT/WSJ) describing a specific deal or set of deals announced by Amazon/AWS in North America that sum to >=1.0 GW nameplate capacity dedicated to data-center power supply.
evidence: AI infrastructure expansion increasingly bottlenecked by power availability: https://www.cnbc.com/2025/12/27/has-the-uks-ai-infrastructure-buildout-been-a-success.html
Interconnect and materials constraints raise the need for large, explicit power procurement: https://spectrum.ieee.org/rf-over-fiber
monitoring_signals: Utility interconnection filings mentioning AWS as offtaker
AWS regional announcements tied to new 'campus' builds
Merchant generator disclosures (gas/nuclear/renewables) naming AWS in offtake agreements
predictions.rationale: Hyperscalers are increasingly forced to secure power at scale; AWS is likely to follow peers with an explicitly GW-sized announcement.

predictions.text: The U.S. 10-year Treasury yield will close at or below 3.50% (New York close) at least once, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: The 10-year Treasury yield (e.g., U.S. Treasury constant maturity 10-year, or widely cited market close such as Reuters) records a New York close <= 3.50% on at least one trading day on/before 2026-06-30.
evidence: Tariff-driven growth/inflation tradeoffs can raise recession-risk scenarios that pull long yields down: https://feeds.feedblitz.com/~/939366320/0/marginalrevolution~The-Macroeconomic-Effects-of-Tariffs-Evidence-From-US-Historical-Data.html
monitoring_signals: Fed communications shifting toward faster easing
ISM/Payroll downside surprises and recession-probability indicators
Inflation measures continuing to cool (core PCE, shelter disinflation)
predictions.rationale: A 3.50% close requires meaningful risk-off or accelerated easing expectations; plausible but not base case within 6 months.

predictions.text: At least one U.S.-listed quantum-computing company (IonQ, Rigetti, D-Wave, or Quantum Computing Inc.) will complete an underwritten public equity offering raising at least $200 million in gross proceeds, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Company press release and/or SEC filing (424B/8-K) confirming pricing/closing of an underwritten public offering with gross proceeds >=$200M (excluding overallotment unless exercised and included in gross).
evidence: Quantum computing is re-emerging as a speculative equity theme; funding needs remain high given limited near-term revenue: https://www.marketwatch.com/story/quantum-stocks-are-where-ai-was-five-years-ago-these-bets-could-be-big-winners-099dcf37?mod=mw_rss_topstories
monitoring_signals: Shelf registration statements becoming effective
ATM usage accelerating and cash runway commentary
Run-ups in quantum stock prices enabling larger deals
predictions.rationale: Speculative rallies often precede dilution; a $200M+ underwritten raise is feasible if valuations remain elevated.

predictions.text: At least one of Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet, or Meta will explicitly cite 'copper' as a supply constraint or cost driver for data-center or AI infrastructure buildouts in an earnings-call transcript, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verbatim mention of 'copper' in the context of constraints/costs for data centers/AI infrastructure in an official quarterly earnings call transcript (company IR site or major transcript provider) for MSFT/AMZN/GOOGL/META on/before 2026-06-30.
evidence: Analyses increasingly point to copper/interconnect as limiting factors for AI data-center scaling: https://spectrum.ieee.org/rf-over-fiber
monitoring_signals: Procurement commentary in capex guidance updates
Supply-chain risk sections in 10-Q/10-K filings mentioning copper/cabling
Utility and contractor lead-time reports for high-voltage and data-center builds
predictions.rationale: If copper becomes a visible bottleneck, hyperscalers are likely to acknowledge it when explaining capex timing and cost pressures.
